result.execSummary:
The defendant Sebastian A Knudsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($243) and DNA surcharge ($200) to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Lucas Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Sebastian A Knudsen in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   

Defendant pleads Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.

Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Withholds Sentence for Probation

TERM OF PROBATION:  6 Months;
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

FINE:  $ 243
DNA Surcharge:  $200
To be paid as a condition of probation.  

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  
Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 11, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Sebastian A Knudsen in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  

State will be amending the charge to a Misdemeanor.
However, State needs time to prepare and file the amended information.
Next court date will be for Plea and Sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 25, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 18, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Sebastian A Knudsen in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with alleged victim/witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Sebastian A Knudsen in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W Benedict.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested    Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.
